host_about:
Hi there! 
(Please feel free to ask me anything about TOKYO!! I would be happy to answer all questions;-))
 I am good at taking care of people and have great hospitality skills.
I have been Airbnb hosting since October 2015, and so far I have very much enjoyed guests from different places!! This Airbnb experience reminds me of when I was in Los Angles back in high school. It was a few decades ago thoughâ€¦ I studied English in LA and stayed with a host family for 1 month, which was the most precious and unforgettable time in my life. I really appreciated my host family because they were very welcoming and treated me so well.
Like my host family in LA, I would like to take care of you and help you enjoy a wonderful stay in Tokyo!
I look forward to hosting you.

neighborhood_overview: Ueno  is a district in Tokyo's TaitÅ Ward, best known as the home of Ueno Park. Ueno is also home to some of Tokyo's finest cultural sites, including the Tokyo National Museum, the National Museum of Western Art, and the National Museum of Nature and Science, as well as a major public concert hall. The Kan'ei-ji, a major temple of the Tokugawa shÅguns, stood in this area, and its pagoda is now within the grounds of the Ueno Zoo. Nearby is the Ueno TÅshÅ-gÅ«, a Shinto shrine dedicated to Tokugawa Ieyasu. Near the Tokyo National Museum there is The International Library of Children's Literature. Just south of the station is the Ameya-yokochÅ, a street market district that evolved out of an open-air black market that sprung up after World War II. Just east is the Ueno motorcycle district, with English-speaking staff available in some stores.

The closest station to the house is Okubo station! It is only 4 min away from the home so it is incredibly convenient!

The main train access you will be using while you stay here is the Sobu line which goes straight to Shinjuku, Akihabara and even Mitaka (Where the Ghibli museum is located)!

ã€About Shinjukuã€‘

Shinjuku is one of the most popular districts of the whole town and is well know to be one of the center of night life in Tokyo. Also the center of entertainment you will find everything there from shopping, game centers and cat cafes to robot restaurants!

Among the most famous parts of the district you will find the Kabukicho, center of entertainment that gathers plenty of bar (even girls or boys bars ^^), Izakaya type restaurants (bar/restaurant) but also the place where you will find the Godzilla cinema, immense building on the side of which there is a huge Godzilla's statue.

neighborhood_overview:
"Yadoya Yanagodori East" is located in Asakusa. This area is center of the one of the most popular areas among both tourists and locals, where you can find the atmosphere of the ancient Japanese town and easy to access to cafes, restaurants and shops. 4 minutes away to Sensoji temple.

"Asakusa" æµ…è‰
Asakusa is the district around Senso-ji Temple and Asakusa Shrine. Many streets here are Japanese â€œshotengaiâ€, shopping streets with lots of small shops. Asakusa has always attracted many visitors, who come not only to visit temples and shrines but also to see performances such as â€œkabukiâ€ theater, â€œmanzaiâ€ comedy, and â€œrakugoâ€ storytelling. It gets crowded during the Sanja Matsuri, the Sumida River Fireworks, and the Asakusa Samba Carnival. Make sure to check the calendar for the many local festivals and events taking place each year. You can explore on foot, take a rickshaw ride, or watch the city from a boat on Sumida River. Restaurants, bars, and cafÃ©s offer a great variet

host_about:
Hello, Iâ€™m jin ya
Thanks lot for visiting my page. Hope you love my apartment.
I currently run my own business in Tokyo.
I haven't been to many countries but I believe traveling can be done in everyday life simply by taking a road not taken before. Adventure is my hobby and love to explore places I've never been and meet people I've never met.
If you would like some inside information, local knowledge or to just hang out and kick back in this vibrant city, I would be more than happy to offer my help and my time to you. 
I take care the apartment as if it is my own home. And I want to make you feel like at home as well.
Also I can speak English and Chinese besides Japanese. Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

neighborhood_overview:
Sumida Ward is home to a famous cherry blossom viewing area (along the Sumida River near Asakusa Station) in spring and the Sumida River Fireworks Festival (Hanabi Matsuri) in summer. Perfect spot for romance-manic :)

The area also boasts a great many Tokyo landmarks such as Tokyo Skytree (you can literally see it from our place), cultural museums (Edo-Tokyo Museum and Tobu Museum), and Ryogoku Kokugikan (Tokyo's main sumo stadium). So if you wanna have a taste of daily yet unique Tokyo lives, don't miss those attractions.

With convenient rail lines and railway stations, you can explore other wards of Tokyo with ease since they bring you to everywhere you might wanna go as a tourist.

It would be a wise choice to start your journey with Japan from here :)

host_about:
Hello
My name is Hirofumi Masuda.
I had been in the US for 3 years, in Italy for 4 months, in Canada for 2 months. I had lived in SF, NY, Philly, Victoria island, Rome, and Florence.

And I also traveled to Netherland, Poland, Croatia, Thailand, China, and South Korea. 

There will be no language barriers between you and me.
When you have some problems, I will help you to solve those problems.
I know how hard to live in other countries because I experienced that.
I love people from all over the world.

My academic status
Victoria University (Canada)
Delaware Country Community College (PA,USA)
John Cabot University (Rome, Italy)
Temple University, Japan Campus (Tokyo, Japan)

Soccer is a part of my life. If you like it, please talk to me about it!!!

Please let me know if you are interested in staying here
I'll be happy to provide a room. :)

Carpe Diem
Hiro

neighborhood_overview:
About Shinjuku
Shinjuku is one of the biggest cities in Tokyo. Great spot for shopping, sightseeing, drinking, night life and etc. Moreover, Shinjuku is the most popular area for tourists. Shinjuku is the best location to stay for a Tokyo trip with easy access to any area in Tokyo. Trains like JR lines and Tokyo METRO subway lines will take you literally anywhere.

In Shinjuku, there are;
ãƒ»Kabuki-Cho â€“ any kind of night life you can enjoy
ãƒ»Shinjuku National Gyoen Park â€“ Japanese traditonal style garden
ãƒ»Isetan Department Store â€“ shopping mall with luxury and latest fashion brand stores.
ãƒ»Tokyo Metropolitan Government Office - Free observation deck at 202m high. You can see Mt.Fuji on sunny days.

----- For more details !!! -----
ã€Please have a look at the guidebook on my listing page to see my best recommended restaurants, bars and shops nearby the apartment.ã€‘

I'm sure you will love it and enjoy the stay in Tokyo.
host_about:
Hi everyone my name is Shinju.
 I love travelling and exploring new cultures.
Since I was a child I used to travel abroad to improve my English, I used to live in the U.K. where I became very passionate about Europe and its art and history, little by little I start travelling also around Asia and US.
I had the opportunity to get in touch with different people from all over the world, thatâ€™s why I have started hosting to keep getting in touch with many people from different countries!
I now work in Tokyo as an s/e of IT industry. I know this city pretty well, so I can suggest you many spots and things to do and enjoy of this city!
I hope you will have a wonderful holiday in my country and make incredible memories!

I'd love to introduce my host friends, Azuki and Maki and Hatsuko! They own apartments in Shinjuku and Shibuya area.
Take a look at their lovely rooms!
Azuki - https://www.airbnb.jp/users/show/217140240
Maki - https://www.airbnb.jp/users/show/241780496
Hatsuko - https://www.airbnb.jp/users/show/253371486
Hope your stay will be a wonderful one:)
Thank you,
Shinju

neighborhood_overview:
Our property is located in an excellent location for quietness in the middle of the bustling city. It perfectly integrates the prosperity of Tokyo's modern business and the quietness of classical culture. The cherry tree in front of the door has a history of more than 100 years. During the cherry blossom season, you can lie on the bed and enjoy the full The tree is blooming.

Bunkyo District is one of the 6 core districts in Tokyo's core 23 districts, along with Shinjuku, Shibuya, Chiyoda, Shinagawa, and Chuo District. It can be described as a prime location in the city center. This is the university town of Tokyo, and the famous Tokyo University is located here. The whole block is full of rich cultural atmosphere, and even the name of the street is called "Street of Knowledge".

The property is next to Yushima Tenmangu (Yujima Tenjin), just turn left when you go out. Yushima Tenjin is a super-effective shrine for studying in Tokyo. There are cherry blossom festiva

neighborhood_overview:
This place is literally around the corner of the business and commercial center, buildingâ€™s neighbourhood is superconvenient to be as a tourist/student because of its centrality you really get as much out of you time in tokyo as you do not have to commute to the center every day. In the same block of this guesthouse, there are many cheap restaurants, fast food shops, 3 big supermarkets, 3 convenience stores (7/11 , lawson and family mart) and 2 huge famous department stores on just 5 minutes walk (Don Quihote and Isetan).
Shin-Okubo Korean town is also nearby, at just 6min walk you can find the entrance, the place in tokyo for everything exclusively Korean: food, K-pop, cloth stores, cosmetics and many other things by Korean people.

Welcome To Tokyo!
Our stylish Japanese styled room is about 8 min. from Ogikubo St.
This is the perfect room for sightseeing, shopping, and enjoying Japanese lifestyle. It has great access to stations such as Shinjuku, Tokyo, and Akihabara. We highly recommend this room for guests who want to enjoy Tokyo. there are convenience stores, restaurants within a 2 minute walk distance.

The space

neighborhood_overview:
Ogikubo Station has all the daily goods you need and is the most comfortable place to stay for travelers! After about 5 minutes on foot from the station, there is a quiet residential area. There are 4 lines running at the station (JR Chuo Line, JR Sobu Line, Tokyo Metro Tozai Line, Tokyo Metro Marunouchi Line) so it has great access to popular areas in Tokyo like Shinjuku St., Akihabara St., Tokyo St. and so on!

Near the Station
24 hr super market, convenience store in front of the station
Several coffee shops at a 2 min walk distance from the station
Hot spring â€œTokyo Ogikubo Tennen Onsen Nagomi no Yuâ€ at a 1 min walk distance from station < (URL HIDDEN)
host_about:
Hi I'm Risa.
Thank you for visiting my page.

As for myself, my hobbies are playing sports(especially Golf and volleyball), watching sports(ice hockey), riding horses, and traveling.
Until now I've been to Australia, Canada, US, UK, Netherlands, Germany, Switzerland, Liechtenstein, Italy, Monaco, France, Peru, Bolivia, Korea, Taiwan and Malaysia. (hope I didn't miss any...)
I also enjoy traveling around Japan from northern Hokkaindo to southern Okinawa.
Let us know if you need some help with your destinations/activities while you stay here ;) 

Also, I would be more than happy to meet you in person and spend some time talking/eating/drinking with you if you would like. (I could invite my friends as well; the more the merrier...!)
Look forward to see you in Tokyo anyway ;)

host_about:
* Lived in the U.K. and Ireland for 2 years in total. Visited about 50 countries and areas in the world including the continent of Africa. Most of the places are seaports as they were stops of Peaceboat that is a cruise ship and takes voyages from Japan to Japanâ€“â€“a round world literally. Took Peaceboat twice, once as a passenger, and second time as a teacher for the school on the sea through the voyage.

Worked as a reception staff living in the site for 2 and a half years at a hotel for backpackers. Stayed in an Airbnb accommodation in Asakusa for 2 years, working as a staff in the house. For over a decade, the living places were always with other people such as shared houses! 

Because of experiences working as a Montessori teacher, international school teacher, nursery teacher and nannyâ€¦, will always welcome to meet children in MOMO HOUSE.

neighborhood_overview:
About Shinjuku
Shinjuku is one of the biggest cities in Tokyo. Great spot for shopping, sightseeing, drinking, night life and etc. Moreover, Shinjuku is the most popular area for tourists. Shinjuku is the best location to stay for a Tokyo trip with easy access to any area in Tokyo. Trains like JR lines and Tokyo METRO subway lines will take you literally anywhere.

In Shinjuku, there are;
ãƒ»Kabuki-Cho â€“ any kind of night life you can enjoy
ãƒ»Shinjuku National Gyoen Park â€“ Japanese traditonal style garden
ãƒ»Isetan Department Store â€“ shopping mall with luxury and latest fashion brand stores.
ãƒ»Tokyo Metropolitan Government Office - Free observation deck at 202m high. You can see Mt.Fuji on sunny days.

I'm sure you will love it and enjoy the stay in Tokyo.
I would love to help you with ANYTHING before/during and even after your stay to make your trip an even more wonderful one.
If you need any further information, feel free to ask me! :)
host_about:
Hi, I'm Fumi! 
I'm a graduate of  University and working for an IT company in Shinjuku area. 
I do understand English since I spent a few years in LA.
 My English skill is not good enough though:( 
Japanese, English and Chinese are available so don't hesitate to contact me!
 I own a apartment in Shinjuku  area and located within walking distance from stations.
 I warmly welcome from a single traveler to a  family!! 

I'm starting from the smallest thing to be a better host. So feel free to let me know ANYTHING on your mind. I'd love to make your trip a wonderful one together!

The apartment itself is in a quiet neighborhood and it is hard to believe that it is right in the thick of mega-city Tokyo.

neighborhood_overview:
Shimoigusa area is a very convenient residential area.
There is a shopping street right in front of the station, where you can find supermarkets, pharmacies, cafes, restaurants, bars, bakeries, and other all kinds of shops making your stay more convenient.

The neighborhood itself is very calm and safe, as it is away from the busy and crowded central areas of Tokyo.

Come and stay at my accommodation to experience more relaxed and laid-back side of Tokyo!

name: Rental unit in Shinjuku-ku Â· â˜…4.83 Â· 1 bedroom Â· 2 beds Â· 1 bath
description:
Welcome to Tokyo!
*A 6-minute walk from Wakamatsu Kawada Station on the Oedo Line will get you to our house!
*One room in a good location in the Shinjuku area!
*There are convenience stores and supermarkets nearby.
*You can fully enjoy not only shopping but also sightseeing!
*Convenient access, ideal for business trips.
*Because it's far from the commercial area, you can sleep quietly at night!
Please enjoy your stay.
If you are interested, please contact us ^_^

The space
The room has 2 Semi-double beds and can accommodate up to 4 people. All sheets, duvet covers and pillowcases will be replaced with new ones for each reservation.

WIFI, kitchen, TV, hair dryer, air conditioner, microwave oven, refrigerator, cooking utensils (pots, frying pans, plates) are all available. You can enjoy not only eating out but also cooking with your family and friends.

name: Rental unit in Setagaya-ku Â· â˜…4.90 Â· Studio Â· 2 beds Â· 1 bath
description:
Located less than 15 minutes away from the famous shopping town Shibuya, Yoga is conveniently located near but very much out of the Hustle of the mega-city. A quiet, cozy, and family friendly area, there are many convenient, unique, and nearby supermarkets, shops, restaurants, and parks to explore. This building houses several real Japanese tenants, so you will live just like a local. This property is a great choice for medium term, monthly stays.

The space
The place which I call the ANIME room, styled in modern Japanese design. Enjoy your stay at a uniquely designed room with a cozy double sofa-bed and 1 futon. The room has a kitchen, 1 bathroom and toilet, and a small balcony where the washing machine is placed. Located at 1st floor and easy access to the room.

Yoga 103.

Enjoy a full access of the whole apartment. It will be your home away from home in Tokyo. It comes fully equipped with everything you will need du

description:
[About 4 minutes on foot from Shin Okachimachi Station] Family Room in Upper Floor

Sakura Cross Hotel Ueno Okachimachi is a beautiful hotel opened in 2019 and close to the station.
This is a completely private hotel located in a convenient location near the station. Please use it as a base for business trips, sightseeing, expedition, etc.
Rooms are equipped with towels, air conditioning and flat-screen TV! The entire hotel is non-smoking.

The space
[Location]
Located in Tokyo, Sakura Cross Hotel Ueno Okachimachi is 400 meters from Chogoji Temple and 600 meters from Katsushika Hokusai's Tomb. Free WiFi is available. Located within 1 km from Rinko-ji Temple, a 12-minute walk from Eimi-ji Temple and 1 km from Choju-in Temple, this family room has accommodations.

host_about:
Hello, I'm Yasu! 
I love the outdoors and enjoy things like camping and a good BBQ.
I also enjoy cruising on a boat sometimes.

I love Tokyo very much. 
I love that parts of Tokyo that are always changing,
but I also love the things that stay the same.
I love the adventure as I walk down the street with my Nikon.

I enjoy the modern architecture in town, but I also appreciate the historical architecture.

neighborhood_overview:
â˜† There are large parks such as Sarue Park and Komatsugawa Park within walking distance, so it is ideal for sports and picnics

â˜† Gyoza and Yakiniku are famous at the nearest JR Kameido station! There are also many cheap Japanese style bars in this area. I recommend you to try it!

â˜†Nakanohashi Shopping Street and Sunamachi Ginza Shopping Street are also nearby, so you can enjoy walking around and eating! We also recommend self-catering, as fresh ingredients are cheaply available.
host_about: Hi! I was traveling around the world for about three years. I saw great landscape that I had never seen, and I did many things that I couldn't experience in Japan! However, the most valuable asset of myself was meeting various people. I received lots of love and kindness from the people that I met. I would like to provide a place where you can have a comfortable stay, and a chance to have new experiences and meet new people! Thank you.

American vintage theme hotel, spacious layout with 165 sq meters, 3 bed room unit.75-inch large-screen TV!

Equipped with a dining table for up to 10, a sofa that can seat 8, and a large kitchen.

Each bedroom has 2double beds and 1single bed with a desk. There is also a vanity in the bed room as well.

High end furniture and appliances, large TV, and washing machine is also equipped in the unit

Please come enjoy the American Vintage themed hotel.

The space
165square meters of living space, with 3 bedrooms

The interior was designed by a designer with an vintage American theme.

Large dining table that can seat more than 10 guests

75-inch TV
Blu-ray DVD player

Washing machine

A very popular brand of mattresses used for the beds

neighborhood_overview:
The Tokyo Sky Tree is within a 10-minute walk.
By the Tokyo Sky tree, there is an aquarium, a planetarium along with many souvenir shops and restaurants.
From the Tokyo Sky Tree observatory you can overlook the city of Tokyo.

It takes about 10-15 minutes by train from Oshiage Station to Asakusa, Ueno and Ryogoku.
In Asakusa there are old Japanese towns, and in Ueno there are museums and zoos, and in the spring there are cherry blossoms.
At Ryogoku, there is a traditional Japanese sumo venue.

There are two 7-Eleven convenience stores nearby (each a 3-minute walk)
5 minute walk to the grocery store

description:
Hotel aima has just opened in June 2021. It is an apartment-type hotel where you can stay as if you were living in Ueno, an area where various cultures intersect.
During your comfortable stay, you can encounter books that you would not normally see and make new discoveries in the city. We hope you will enjoy your time at the hotel in the "in-between" of the ordinary and the extraordinary.

host_about:
Hello everyone, I am Pang Yi Ling, a Chinese people who have been in Japan for more than 20 years. I engaged in public welfare activities in China.
 Rescue stray animals for about 15 years.
 Yiyi HOUSE West Shinjuku was built in 2011 with reinforced concrete and can resist magnitude 8 earthquake. In 2017,  Yiyi HOUSE West Shinjuku was designed by a Chinese dream transformer Mr Takafumi Honma, a Japanese designer and was reported by Oriental Television. More than 95% of the supplies in  Yiyi HOUSE West Shinjuku Hotel are from Nidali Furniture Sales Shop, a famous Japanese brand. Yiyi HOUSE West Shinjuku started its business on September 1st. We receive tourists from home and abroad with preferential prices and good environment. It can help provide convenience for visitors to Japan, make more friends and contribute their love to rescue more stray animals.

neighborhood_overview:
About Shinjuku
Shinjuku is one of the biggest cities in Tokyo. Great spot for shopping, sightseeing, drinking, night life and etc. Moreover, Shinjuku is the most popular area for tourists. Shinjuku is the best location to stay for a Tokyo trip with easy access to any area in Tokyo. Trains like JR lines and Tokyo METRO subway lines will take you literally anywhere.

In Shinjuku, there are;
ãƒ»Kabuki-Cho â€“ any kind of night life you can enjoy
ãƒ»Shinjuku National Gyoen Park â€“ Japanese traditonal style garden
ãƒ»Isetan Department Store â€“ shopping mall with luxury and latest fashion brand stores.
ãƒ»Tokyo Metropolitan Government Office - Free observation deck at 202m high. You can see Mt. Fuji on sunny days.

Hello, this is The Breathing Hotel Tokyo

Our hotel is a large hotel with 185 rooms, which has been used by many corporations. 
The operating company is also selected as an official partner of airbnb, so please feel free to make the reservation. 

ï¼œConceptï¼
A quiet place away from the crowds at the station.
I often get tired of traveling, tired of work, and suffocated,
Sometimes I feel tired from traveling, I feel tired from work, and I am suffocated, 
but staying here makes my heart feel better, and on the next morning, 
take a deep breath and say, "I'll do my best today." I think.
And the gait becomes lighter than usual.

A hotel where you can feel the joy of breathing
A hotel that is always close to you, like breathing
Please welcome the beginning of a wonderful day at The Breathing Hotel Tokyo.

description:
The apartment close to Ikebukuro.
You will have the entire apartment for yourselves.
A maximum of 3 people can stay here since there is one double bed and one sofa bed.

The station is only a 3 minute-walk away from the apartment and is close to various supermarkets and urban shops!

neighborhood_overview:
Oyama station (3min walk) : On your way to the house from here you will see lots of bars and restaurants! You won't even feel the distance with the amount of things you will pass by here ^^
ã€€ã€€â†’Main train line you will be using is the Tobu Tojo Line. With this line you can head straight to Ikebukuro station.

ã€About Ikebukuroã€‘

Ikebukuro is one of the biggest and most popular districts along with Shinjuku and Shibuya.
Once you wander nearby Ikebukuro station, you can find various selections of shops and restaurants.
Very popular among young people you will find bar, Izakaya type restaurants, bowling, baseball center (on rooftops!), shopping malls, anime, manga-related stores, theme cafes and a lot more.

Also if you are interested in Japanese Anime culture, Ikebukuro is one of Tokyo's district that you have to visit.
One day is definitely not long enough to enjoy this city!

host_about:
Hello there!

I'm Kazumi.
Tokyo is a very exciting city, but it also has some good old townscapes, and there are new discoveries every day.
There are delicious restaurants, cafes with lots of greenery, places where you can interact with animals, stores where you can buy unique things...
Tokyo is evolving every day. There is sure to be a place for you to enjoy.

Through Airbnb, I hope to make you fall in love with Japan.
The rooms I have available are as comfortable as possible so that you can have the experience of living in Tokyo.
The rooms may be made differently from those in your country. You may find it inconvenient.
But please try to enjoy the differences!
I am sensitive to your troubles and can help you.
You don't have to feel anxious. Please feel free to contact me at any time before making an appointment.
I would love to talk to you guys :)

I like to watch soccer and go to the gym to work out.
At home, I play a game called Fortnite on my switch.
I'd love to know what you like to do too!

neighborhood_overview:
About Shinjuku
Shinjuku is one of the biggest cities in Tokyo. Great spot for shopping, sightseeing, drinking, night life and etc. Moreover, Shinjuku is the most popular area for tourists. Shinjuku is the best location to stay for a Tokyo trip with easy access to any area in Tokyo. Trains like JR lines and Tokyo METRO subway lines will take you literally anywhere.

In Shinjuku, there are;
ãƒ»Kabuki-Cho â€“ any kind of night life you can enjoy

ãƒ»Tokyo Metropolitan Government Office - Free observation deck at 202m high. You can see Mt. Fuji on sunny days.

There's one of the biggest Korean town in tokyo and a downtown area of â€‹â€‹Shinjuku.
There are many convenience stores and supermarkets around there, you can enjoy the exciting atmosphere.
It's is good for eating and shopping , of course good for also business as well.

[Around Okubo Station]
As mentioned above, there are Korean Town, many restaurants and supermarkets.

Okubo Station, one of the most enjoyable entertainment districts in Tokyo, is one of the best accessible locations on the JR Chuo Line / JR Chuo Sobu Line from Shinjuku Station.
You can also walk to Shin-Okubo Station on the JR Yamanote Line and Nishi-Shinjuku Station on the Tokyo Metro Marunouchi Line,
The location is convenient for going out.
The r
host_about:
Hi I'm Risa.
Thank you for visiting my page.

As for myself, my hobbies are playing sports(especially Golf and volleyball), watching sports(ice hockey), riding horses, and traveling.
Until now I've been to Australia, Canada, US, UK, Netherlands, Germany, Switzerland, Liechtenstein, Italy, Monaco, France, Peru, Bolivia, Korea, Taiwan and Malaysia. (hope I didn't miss any...)
I also enjoy traveling around Japan from northern Hokkaindo to southern Okinawa.
Let us know if you need some help with your destinations/activities while you stay here ;) 

Also, I would be more than happy to meet you in person and spend some time talking/eating/drinking with you if you would like. (I could invite my friends as well; the more the merrier...!)
Look forward to see you in Tokyo anyway ;)

name: Rental unit in Sumida City Â· â˜…4.18 Â· 2 bedrooms Â· 4 beds Â· 1 bath
description:
A newly modern room which can accommodate up to 8 people, is located in Ryogoku. Ryogoku is Japanese old-fashion area filled with the emotions of the Edo period. Museums, shrines, monuments, museums, sumo rooms ... it is a treasure house of tourist attractions! The origin of sumo which is Japanese national sport is traced back to here, in Ryogoku. If you take trains, you can easily access to Asakusa around 10 mins. It's also convenient for you to reach major cities in Tokyo. Enjoy your trip :)

The space
A newly renovated room is well-equipped which is perfect for your long-stay.

neighborhood_overview:
Edo was one of the biggest cities in the world. Ryogoku is a district famous for its connection with the Japanese national sport of sumo. The people of Edo used to flock to Ryogoku, which is also the birthplace of Edo-style sushi. Also there are museums, shrines, monuments, museums, etc...a treasure house of tourist attractions! I'm sure that you totally enjoy what is good about Japan!
â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•
â˜…æ±Ÿæˆ¸NOREN (Edo-NOREN)
Edo NOREN brings together 12 shops specializing in food such as traditional Edo-style sushi, the authentic chanko-nabe stew eaten by sumo wrestlers, soba (buckwheat noodles), and tempura! But it's not just about food. Many Edo-related events are also held here. Edo NOREN can be accessed directly via the JR Ryogoku Station West Exit.

neighborhood_overview: Uchisaiwaicho is nestled in between Toranomon and Shinbashi station, two districts that house many corporate headquarters. Close by is the Imperial Palace and hotel, Ginza shopping area, Tsuki-ji fish market, and Tokyo station. Its close proximity and easy access to Tokyo's major attractions and business district makes it a convenient location for travelers who want a more tranquil environment, yet be close to the bustling surrounding districts.

description:
Welcome to [KYU KYU HOTEL], which will be the base for sightseeing in Tokyo.
KYU KYU HOTEL is a 2-star hotel located 5 minutes by train from Ueno Station. A 24-hour reception will assist you during your stay. We also support luggage storage, so you can enjoy sightseeing easily.

There are many nearby popular sightseeing spots such as Ueno Park, Ueno Zoo, Ichiyo Memorial Museum, and Jokanji Temple, so you can have a fulfilling Tokyo stay with your family and friends.

The space
The rooms have a private bathroom with the washlet toilet, slippers and a hairdryer.

You can get to the nearest station is Minowa Station on the Tokyo Metro Hibiya Line, which is a 4 to 5 minute walk. From Minowa Station to Ueno Station, it is a 4-minute train ride and Asakusa is about 15 minutes away.
Easy access to Haneda Airport, 19km (about 50 minutes by train).

I manage this guest house with my friend Shigeo and Yoshimi.

My introduction
I like to talk to people from different countries. 

I'm a designer and also an owner of the shared house where people study English.

My purpose for doing B&B is to make people from other countries happy and to have them enjoyed the best staying in Japan.

I'd like people to know not only one side of Japan ( ex. Asakusa, Shibuya, Akihabara ), but also the other side ( local food , culture , people ).

While I'm introducing Japan to foreigners, I'd also like to have Japanese people experienced talking and hanging out with them.
People from my shared house are willing to spend time with travelers.

I like eating, drinking, reading and bourldering.


************************************************
Shigeo Kojima

Hello,
I like to introduce Japanese usual cultures.
I have a lot of wonderful friends any places in a world.
I'm a watchmaker for Swiss watch brand in Tokyo.
I like traveling, taking photos and go out drinking with my friends.

neighborhood_overview: Ueno  is a district in Tokyo's TaitÅ Ward, best known as the home of Ueno Park. Ueno is also home to some of Tokyo's finest cultural sites, including the Tokyo National Museum, the National Museum of Western Art, and the National Museum of Nature and Science, as well as a major public concert hall. The Kan'ei-ji, a major temple of the Tokugawa shÅguns, stood in this area, and its pagoda is now within the grounds of the Ueno Zoo. Nearby is the Ueno TÅshÅ-gÅ«, a Shinto shrine dedicated to Tokugawa Ieyasu. Near the Tokyo National Museum there is The International Library of Children's Literature. Just south of the station is the Ameya-yokochÅ, a street market district that evolved out of an open-air black market that sprung up after World War II. Just east is the Ueno motorcycle district, with English-speaking staff available in some stores.

neighborhood_overview:
Sumida Ward (å¢¨ç”°åŒº, sumida-ku) lies east of central Tokyo. It is home to a famous cherry blossom viewing area (along the Sumida River near Asakusa Station) in spring, the Sumida River Fireworks Festival (Hanabi Matsuri) in summer, and Tokyo's main sumo stadium (Ryogoku Kokugikan) where tournaments are held three times a year. It is also home to the Tokyo SkyTree, the world's tallest self-supporting tower.

The area is considered "shitamachi" (roughly translated as "old town"), though it has become a kind of bedroom community for Tokyoites, which has meant the building of many high-rise apartment buildings.

neighborhood_overview: Ueno  is a district in Tokyo's TaitÅ Ward, best known as the home of Ueno Park. Ueno is also home to some of Tokyo's finest cultural sites, including the Tokyo National Museum, the National Museum of Western Art, and the National Museum of Nature and Science, as well as a major public concert hall. The Kan'ei-ji, a major temple of the Tokugawa shÅguns, stood in this area, and its pagoda is now within the grounds of the Ueno Zoo. Nearby is the Ueno TÅshÅ-gÅ«, a Shinto shrine dedicated to Tokugawa Ieyasu. Near the Tokyo National Museum there is The International Library of Children's Literature. Just south of the station is the Ameya-yokochÅ, a street market district that evolved out of an open-air black market that sprung up after World War II. Just east is the Ueno motorcycle district, with English-speaking staff available in some stores.

neighborhood_overview:
About Shinjuku
Shinjuku is one of the biggest cities in Tokyo. Great spot for shopping, sightseeing, drinking, night life and etc. Moreover, Shinjuku is the most popular area for tourists. Shinjuku is the best location to stay for a Tokyo trip with easy access to any area in Tokyo. Trains like JR lines and Tokyo METRO subway lines will take you literally anywhere.

In Shinjuku, there are;
ãƒ»Kabuki-Cho â€“ any kind of night life you can enjoy
ãƒ»Shinjuku National Gyoen Park â€“ Japanese traditonal style garden
ãƒ»Isetan Department Store â€“ shopping mall with luxury and latest fashion brand stores.
ãƒ»Tokyo Metropolitan Government Office - Free observation deck at 202m high. You can see Mt. Fuji on sunny days.

neighborhood_overview:
As the capital of Japan, Tokyo is the center of Japanese politics, culture and economy. If you want to experience the charm of Japan from various angles, sightseeing in Tokyo is the best choice.
Tokyo not only has many places of interest representing Japanese history and culture, but also incorporates culture and fashion from all over the world. It is also a gourmet base that brings together cuisines from all over the world. In addition to enjoying the latest fashions, special cuisines from various countries, colorful theme parks and scenic spots full of Edo tradition, you can also fully experience Japan's unique otaku culture in Akihabara, the holy land of animation and games. There are many indoor attractions in Tokyo, so you can enjoy sightseeing regardless of the weather regardless of the time of your visit.

description:
Located in the center of Ginza, my apartment is convenient for you to take a shopping street shot so that you can get a close look at Tokyo as a bustling metropolis, while resting on a very quiet street. This is a newly built unmanned hotel apartment which is fully equipped with the most comfortable and clean bedding. Besides, the apartment is just a 3-minute walk from Higashi-Ginza Station and a convenient 7-minute walk from Ginza Station.

The space
-In the heart of Ginza, the lobby that welcomes you is elegantly decorated with the world's top-class furniture items and art works from Italy, German and Japan.
1. Convenient transportation. Ginza, Yurakucho, Hibiya can be reached on foot. Nearest stations: 3 minutes from Higashi-Ginza, 6 minutes from Shin-Fukumachi, 7 minutes from Ginza, and 10 minutes from Tsukiji Station. It is very suitable for some of the net red card punching spots in Tokyo: the shallow grass of the Edo style, the romantic sky-clearing t
neighborhood_overview: My apartment is located in Ginza, Tokyo. Ginza was built in the ruins of the Silver Coin Castings of the Edo Period (1603-1867), and has an elegant atmosphere and historical style that cannot be felt in any other neighborhood. The main road of Ginza Avenue is lined with old-fashioned department stores. Quality service and high-end goods sold in the store complement each other, which attracts many people to come for shopping. In the alleys of Ginza, you not only can enjoy shopping in the fashion stores, but also have the opportunity to sip a small tavern with a small taste. Ginza, which is advancing with the times, is not satisfied with the existing popularity, but exhibits the modernity and vitality rich in cultural heritage, as well as the charm of the ancient and beautiful times. Concentrating on famous Japanese department stores, traditional old shops and high-end luxury goods, it is known as the "heart of Tokyo". Ginza in Tokyo and the Champs ElysÃ©es in Paris and Fifth Avenue in Ne

About Shinjuku
Shinjuku is one of the biggest cities in Tokyo. Great spot for shopping, sightseeing, drinking, night life and etc. Moreover, Shinjuku is the most popular area for tourists. Shinjuku is the best location to stay for a Tokyo trip with easy access to any area in Tokyo. Trains like JR lines and Tokyo METRO subway lines will take you literally anywhere.

neighborhood_overview:
Otsuka station is near toÂ IkebukuroÂ station, on Tokyoâ€™s busy JRÂ Yamanote line. Conveniently located a few minutes from the metropolisâ€™ bustling business, shopping and entertainment hubs, Otsuka is its own relaxed version of Tokyo.

The station itself is not too big. However, the area is bustling with people every August when more than 1,000 dancers participate in the Awa Odori danceÂ festival. Other than that, theÂ stationÂ area is a respite to those who are hanging out in Ikebukuro.

If youâ€™re looking for a change of pace from the hyperactivity of Tokyo, this area is for you. Otsuka has the nostalgic feeling of downtownÂ EdoÂ (old Tokyo). Tucked within its back streets are small shopping arcades and old izakaya. One local bar to try is Edoichi, for some sashimi and (mostly) warmÂ nihonshuÂ (rice wine.)

A local Buddhist temple about a five-minute walk from the station fits right in with the nostalgic atmosphere. Built in the 1600s, Gokoku-ji is famous for being

description:
Its located in Asagaya Sta. where is the livable area in Tokyo.
Its 5 mins walk from Asagaya Sta. & you can get to Shinjuku in 8 mins by train and other major stations in Tokyo are just short ride away by Yamanote Line.
The rooms are equipped with electric funiture & other necessities to provide you.
You can also watch Netflix for free.
Available to stay up to 4 people.
Its suitable for families and groups.

host_about:
Hi I'm Risa.
Thank you for visiting my page.

As for myself, my hobbies are playing sports(especially Golf and volleyball), watching sports(ice hockey), riding horses, and traveling.
Until now I've been to Australia, Canada, US, UK, Netherlands, Germany, Switzerland, Liechtenstein, Italy, Monaco, France, Peru, Bolivia, Korea, Taiwan and Malaysia. (hope I didn't miss any...)
I also enjoy traveling around Japan from northern Hokkaindo to southern Okinawa.
Let us know if you need some help with your destinations/activities while you stay here ;) 

Also, I would be more than happy to meet you in person and spend some time talking/eating/drinking with you if you would like. (I could invite my friends as well; the more the merrier...!)
Look forward to see you in Tokyo anyway ;)

neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood where this listing is located retains the original features of Japan's economic center since ancient times, and is not far from the bustling commercial district. It takes about 10 minutes to Akihabara Business District . You can experience the vitality of the animation world and the famous maid cafe and pet cafe.

The neighborhood Nihonbashi Area has a history of more than 400 years. It was first built during the Tokugawa Ieyasu in 1603 and has been the center of the economy since the Edo period. [Fish River Bank] on the northeast side of Nihonbashi, benefiting from the rich water resources of Nihonbashi River, has gathered a wide variety of fish from various places and has become a famous seafood trading market. There has been a huge trade volume since ancient times. Now we see a lot of Japanese restaurants still use [fish river bank] as the shop name, and that is where the allusions come from.
host_about: Welcome to my fantastic house. I love traveling and also love to make friends. I carefully prepared and decorated my house for you. Wish you have a nice trip in Tokyo.

name: Hostel in Taito City Â· â˜…5.0 Â· 1 bedroom Â· 2 beds Â· 4 shared baths
description:
Hostel brightly illuminates the back alleys of Asakusa

The symbolic Sensoji Temple, the lively Nakamise Street, and the nostalgic atmosphere of the old downtown, Asakusa has many different faces on each street.

Glamping Tokyo Asakusa has both a stylish atmosphere with an Edo "iki" theme and a warm atmosphere where people can mingle.

Why don't you use this hostel, where the world and Japan meet, as a base to explore this place where the good old days of Japanese culture still remain?

The space
1 bunk bed
Twin room with terrace has an air-conditioner and a free Wi-Fi.

Other things to note
For guests under 18 years of age, a parental consent form is required. Please bring it with you when you check in (free format, signature required). If you require a template, please contact the hostel.

host_about:
Hello~
It is jung of Jjhaus.
It has been 7 years since I became a Tokyo citizen .
In our apartment where our couple started a newly-married life to Tokyo
I'm happy to have started meeting people who came to the trip.
Travel is always fresh, I think it is like a good friend.
Our couple who likes to travel also often travels to new places and familiar sites every year.
It is a jj house that began in time.
One newly-married room often visits Tokyo in many countries, increasing the number of jjhaus's rooms, so it was decided to lightly write such a greeting.
In order for us to continue good relationships in the future,
It still remains in the space you want to stay.

name: Home in Sumida-ku Â· â˜…4.66 Â· 2 bedrooms Â· 5 beds Â· 2 baths
description:
This house has been renovated recently in a modern style traditional Japanese style with its Japanese style living room for example.
Nevertheless, it is in the same time modern and well equipped to make your stay confortable and enjoyable.

Only 7 minutes to Asakusa, the house is located 2 minutes away from Yahiro station.
It is a 2 stories house that can host up to 12 people with 2 bedroom equipped with 5 double beds.

If you like Japanese style you can also use 2 futons in the living room. : )

The space

- Double bed Ã— 5
- Single Futon (Japanese bed/mattress) Ã— 2

neighborhood_overview:
This house is only 2 minutes away walking from Yahiro station.
This location offers a great access to the rest of Tokyo and especially to Asakusa (7 minutes in train).


ã€About Asakusaã€‘

Asakusa is one of the most touristic area in Tokyo, well known for its buddhist amazing temple named Sensoji, and its Nakamise, which is the name of a long shopping street full of gift shops leading to the temple itself.
We obviously can not talk about Sensoji without talking about Kaminarimon (the thunder gate), a big red gate built it traditional style where tourists line up to take a picture.
You can also take look at the area and discover its main spots by getting around with a rickshaw.
In other words it is the perfect place to discover or re-discover Tokyo's traditional face and explore a spiritual place where I am sure, you will make a lot of unforgettable memories!

description:
We have prepared the room to welcome new travelers in a quiet residential area.
It is an 8-minute walk from Takadanobaba Station and a 5-minute train ride to Shinjuku Ikebukuro.
There are convenience stores, supermarkets, countless taverns, ramen shops, and cafes nearby.
I also like to travel, so I always try to welcome you from the standpoint of Guest.
We look forward to welcoming you!

The space
The room is on the second floor.
We have other rooms in the same building, so please have a look from the profile page.

â˜… Free Wi-Fi â˜…
wi-fi is available.
You can use it freely during your stay.

â˜… Equipment â˜…

Â -Single size sofa bed (97Ã—195cm)

neighborhood_overview:
About Takadanobaba
There are tons of restaurants and shops within a 10-minute walk, and it is famous as a student district including Waseda University. The Kanda River flows nearby and it is a lively and safe area that is easy to spend.

About Shinjuku
Shinjuku is one of the biggest cities in Tokyo. Great spot for shopping, sightseeing, drinking, night life and etc. Moreover, Shinjuku is the most popular area for tourists. Shinjuku is the best location to stay for a Tokyo trip with easy access to any area in Tokyo. Trains like JR lines and Tokyo METRO subway lines will take you literally anywhere.

In Shinjuku, there are;
ï½¥Kabuki-Cho â€“ any kind of night life you can enjoy
ï½¥Shinjuku National Gyoen Park â€“ Japanese traditonal style garden
ï½¥Isetan Department Store â€“ shopping mall with luxury and latest fashion brand stores.
ï½¥Tokyo Metropolitan Government Office - Free observation deck at 202m high. You can see Mt.Fuji on sunny days.
host_about:
Hello. My name is Keisuke.
I am 26 years old, studied at Waseda University in Tokyo.
I spent my high school days in Australia and New Zealand.
When I think back the past, this was a life changing event for me. I stayed at some hosts' places and I had a warm welcome from them.
And I thought that time I would love to host travelers from all over the world. 

I, myself like to travel like you all do.
In (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) , I went to Hong Kong, Singapore, Taiwan and Thailand.
And last year, I visited France, Germany, Switzerland and Italy.
Hopefully I will visit other beautiful places this year.
I might stay with some of you when I go visit your place :)

I'm not a perfect host but I'm trying to be perfect!
Any kind of feedback is really appreciated.
Let me make your trip a wonderful one.

Hope you have a wonderful time here!
Thank you,
Keisuke

host_about:
Hello,  Iâ€™m Hiroo from Japan. I graduate from Waseda University. I like outdoor sports. 
I basically go snowboarding every year when the snow season is coming:) 
It makes me relax like a bird on snow mountains. I used to study aboard in NS, Canada for one year with my snowboard. I explored in a new country Iâ€™ve never been before and learned some western culture which was a very valuable experience for me. That's why I built a new hotel with my partners after I came back to Tokyo. :)
We would like to share Japanese culture and provide a great service to travelers all over the world. To make everyone a memorable trip!

Start from our booking... text me! :)

description:
Very close to the subway station 2 min walk.ã€€
Japanese style room.

The space
No smoking, No shoes.
I will provide tableware,hair dryer in the room. You should bring them back in your room after you used them outside of the room.
You can use free wifi in the house.

Guest access
Everywhere is OK. Except other's room.

During your stay
We are living on the first floor.
I will meet you to do check in procedure and give you a key.
According to the law before check in you have to give me photos of all your passports.
Send me them through this Airbnb chat.
If it is impossible email them to my email address.
Or if you want me to take a photo of all your passports at the check in time.
And you have to fill in the register sheet.
Each of you should fill in below for the register sheet.
Also send me them through this Airbnb chat.

Home address:
neighborhood_overview:
There are 2 lines. 2 min walk to Shin-egota Station on the Toei O-edo Line and 7 min walk to Egoda Station on the Seibu Ikebukuro Line.
3 super markets are close. You can enjoy Japanese everyday life.
Convenience store, coin laundry and drug store are all within 3 min walk distance.
There are 3 universities here, so many reasonable restaurants are.
1 min walk to the bus station to Nakano, 5 min walk to the bus station to Shinjuku.
10 min walk to the park.

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located near the Shiba Park and Tokyo Tower in central Tokyo.
Shiba Park is one of the oldest parks in Tokyo, just like Ueno Park. It has wide grassland, shaded trees and children's facilities, a good place for adults to relax and for children to enjoy. the Tokyo Tower on the west side of the park is one of the must-see attractions for tourists; The magnificent temple in the park is also popular as one of the spiritual temples of the Edo government of the famous Tokugawa family. Other famous spots such as Roppongi, Azabu Shiban, Shigiyagiya and Mita shopping streets are also nearby.
host_about:

I have lived in Tokyo for more than 10 years.
I can speak English, Japanese and Mandarin.

I enjoy traveling and would love to offer you not only cozy rooms but also tips for your unique trip in Japan.

Contact me if you have any questions!

name: ryokan in Setagaya City Â· 1 bedroom Â· 2 beds Â· 2.5 shared baths
description:
Wabi Sabi Hostel is a small hostel that just opened this spring in Sangenjaya where just 1 stop from Shibuya by Rapid train.

We have single rooms and twin rooms, mainly mix dormitories.
(The number after the title is the room number or bed number.)

In addition, we have adopted a self-check-in system using ICT,
so you can enter the room without hesitation.

Please enjoy the Japanese taste of the babbling brook and the sound of the SUIKINKUTSU.
There is also a Sento, a rabbit shrine, nearby.

The space
This is a twin type room.
1 person also available.

*Because it is a wooden hostel, even private rooms are not suitable for infants who cry at night.Also, there is limited space to put a stroller.

Other things to note
â— All buildings and premises are non-smoking.
â— Strictly no shoes. Please use the slippers with your room number.
â— There is a trash can in the kitchen. Ple

Hello, I'm Yasu! 
I love the outdoors and enjoy things like camping and a good BBQ.
I also enjoy cruising on a boat sometimes.

I love Tokyo very much. 
I love that parts of Tokyo that are always changing,
but I also love the things that stay the same.
I love the adventure as I walk down the street with my Nikon.

I enjoy the modern architecture in town, but I also appreciate the historical architecture.

neighborhood_overview: Ueno  is a district in Tokyo's TaitÅ Ward, best known as the home of Ueno Park. Ueno is also home to some of Tokyo's finest cultural sites, including the Tokyo National Museum, the National Museum of Western Art, and the National Museum of Nature and Science, as well as a major public concert hall. The Kan'ei-ji, a major temple of the Tokugawa shÅguns, stood in this area, and its pagoda is now within the grounds of the Ueno Zoo. Nearby is the Ueno TÅshÅ-gÅ«, a Shinto shrine dedicated to Tokugawa Ieyasu. Near the Tokyo National Museum there is The International Library of Children's Literature. Just south of the station is the Ameya-yokochÅ, a street market district that evolved out of an open-air black market that sprung up after World War II. Just east is the Ueno motorcycle district, with English-speaking staff available in some stores.

description:
Welcome to "Agora Place Tokyo Asakusa"!

The concept of Agora Place Tokyo Asakusa is "Style my stay", a hotel where guests can create their own original stay.
The rooms are simply furnished, and you can choose amenities and services to suit your needs and mood.
Enjoy your own style of stay.

The space
Our policy is not to receive any "waste" from our guests.
Agora Place Tokyo Asakusa offers inexpensive accommodations by "excluding amenities that are not used by some guests (i.e., those with varying usage records)" and "not providing amenities that may or may not be used" from the various amenities that are usually included in the room rate, thereby contributing to the environment.

The design of is full of modern Japanese style, with the dim lighting and wooden decoration in the corridor, and the rooms designed by Japanese style and western style.

In the calm and peaceful Japanese-style room, the scent of tatami eliminate fatigue of the travelers. Sitting on the floor freely, travelers can collect today's mood and preparing for tomorrow's trip. In the Western-style room, clean and soft mattresses provide exhausted travelers with the most comfortable service.

The space

The Fukutoshin Line stops along the road to Ikebukuro, Shinjuku, Meiji Jingu, Harajuku, and Shibuya. The Oedo Line can go to Ueno and Roppongi, and you can experience the ever-changing Tokyo without changing trains (Add: The next stop is Shinjuku Station).

neighborhood_overview:
As the capital of Japan, Tokyo is the center of Japanese politics, culture and economy. If you want to experience the charm of Japan from various angles, sightseeing in Tokyo is the best choice.
Tokyo not only has many places of interest representing Japanese history and culture, but also incorporates culture and fashion from all over the world. It is also a gourmet base that brings together cuisines from all over the world. In addition to enjoying the latest fashions, special cuisines from various countries, colorful theme parks and scenic spots full of Edo tradition, you can also fully experience Japan's unique otaku culture in Akihabara, the holy land of animation and games. There are many indoor attractions in Tokyo, so you can enjoy sightseeing regardless of the weather regardless of the time of your visit.

Details of the room
neighborhood_overview:
Our place is located in the center area of Tokyo city , within walking distance to the Imperial Palace, Tokyo Station, Ginza and Akihabara (within 15-20min);near to the Bank of Japan, the Mitsukoshi Isetan department store, the Muromachi shopping center, etc., where you can buy Japanese souvenirs and enjoy Japanese food.
There are many subway routes in the area, including the JR line, the Ginza line, the Hanzomon line, the Hibiya line, the Asakusa line, and so on.
It is a 4-minutes walk from Mitsukoshimae Station ( Metro Ginza Line and Metro Hanzomon Line) , and a 4-minute walk from Kodenmacho Station ( Metro Hibiya Line).
It is also very convenient for visitors, who come and go to Narita and Haneda airports. There is a shuttle bus from the airport to Tokyo Station and this way ,currently, is the most comfortable, cheapest and fastest route. We are located just 15 minutes walk from Tokyo Station .

Welcome to our page. Thank you for visiting our profile. : )
We own a few houses in Tokyo to host you during your stay in the capital. We will do our best in order to provide you the best service possible.
We comply with Japan legislation to offer to our customers, a legal, safe, renovated and cosy place for their stay. 
We would do our best to help you create the best memories possible of your stay in Tokyo by helping you with transportation to Tokyo's best sightseeing spots, help with eventual trouble that you may meet, or make you suggestions for your stay.
We would love hosting you and hope that you will choose us!
Waiting for your message.

I propose a 3-tatami private Japanese style room in a small house in a quiet residential area.
I would like to welcome my guests as a friend and a family member.
I have an eco-friendly lifestyle. I try to recycle my garbage and to minimize disposable items as much as possible. I would be happy to discuss and share stories with my guests.

The space
The 3-tatami mat room is on the second floor, on the left of the stairs. My room is on the right. The toilet, bathroom, and kitchen are on the first floor. There is also a small garden.

Guest access
Except for our private rooms on the second floor, we share the space on the first floor.
For consecutive nights, I will enter the guest room for cleaning.

neighborhood_overview:
Koganei, Tokyo, Japan
It is a quiet neighborhood with many parks and green areas at walking distances from the house, such as Kushino Park, Kuriyama Park, Koganei Park, where locals and families often go to rest, walk and play. There also is a very nice path to walk along the Nogawa river leading to the Nogawa Park.
If you like walking or cycling, you can reach the Tama Lake through a beautiful walking/cycling road with many places to rest on the way.
Koganei is a charming town with many cafes, specialty coffee shops, restaurants and shops.

host_about:
I like to travel and to look for interesting places where to stay, while walking around the city enjoying the architecture of buildings and the historical landmarks, looking for local shops and restaurants with homemade meals, learning about local stories and dialects. Motivated by such experiences, I decided to start hosting travelers wishing to help them by providing an accommodation and the opportunity to discover non-touristic places and lifestyle of the locals.

name: Rental unit in Itabashi-ku Narimasu Â· â˜…4.77 Â· 1 bedroom Â· 1 bed Â· 1 bath
description:
This is an old style Japanese apartment located in the quiet suburb of Narimasu, about 30 minutes from Tokyo center. With access to public transport just a few minutes walk away, it is quick and easy to get just about anywhere in Tokyo.

There are express buses going between both Haneda and Narita airports and Wakou-shi (just one station away from Narimasu).

This building was built by my grandfather many years ago. It is now maintained by my family and is an important legacy for us.

The space
A old Japanese style apartment with Kitchen, bathroom, and living room/bedroom.

Guest access
The building has a shared laundry room.

Other things to note
The building is over 30 years old but is well maintained and rooms receive updates as needed.

name: Rental unit in Suginami City Â· â˜…4.68 Â· 2 bedrooms Â· 2 beds Â· 1 bath
description:
A 1 minute walk from Station, nearest AirBnB property from Koenji Station. Shinjuku Station is a 6-minute away by rapid train ride from Shinjuku Station. 1F is an inexpensive gourmet Italian restaurant with many selection of wine. 2F is a bar. run by a friendly music lover. This Area is uniquely lively and fascinating place for discovering real Japanese market and many unique restaurants and shops. Food is much cheaper than other hubs of Tokyo. Enjoy this vibrant unbeaten track in Koenji.

The space
Fully renovated 2 floors, 1 apartment on each. Fully renovated 2 floors, 1 apartment on each floor. This apartment is the one on the 4th floor and it has free roof top use.

Guest access
Each floor has only one apartment so each apartment have exclusive use of the premises.
There is a door to access the rooftop 5th floor in side the apartment. Please enjoy the landscape from the rooftop.

Other things to note
Fit up t
neighborhood_overview:
There are many restaurants, and there are various types of restaurants. This is a very cheap area, 30% to 60% cheaper than the restaurants in Shinjuku Station and Shibuya Station.
Seven Eleven, pharmacy and spar market are 50 meters (30 seconds on foot) from the house.
There are several dining options within a 1-minute walk of Italian, Bar, Yakiniku Tavern, Seafood Restaurant, Okinawa Soba Restaurant, Tavern, Family Restaurant, Gyudon Chain Store, etc.
We prepared this accommodation in the shopping/dinig street. You can go to bed while drinking and watching various shops and go to Shinjuku Station for 6 minutes by train. it is beyond luxuary!

The kitchen has a refrigerator, microwave, IH stove, electric kettle, cutting board, kitchen knife, scissors, wine opener, can opener, bottle opener, cutlery, dishes and utensils, but no food or seasoning.

This is a new style hostel mix three elements "tea,movie, and travel" in one space. and people in this place can notice new things by way of overlapping scenery.

Stay at a tent on prosthetic grass, dormitory style.

host_about:
* Lived in the U.K. and Ireland for 2 years in total. Visited about 50 countries and areas in the world including the continent of Africa. Most of the places are seaports as they were stops of Peaceboat that is a cruise ship and takes voyages from Japan to Japanâ€“â€“a round world literally. Took Peaceboat twice, once as a passenger, and second time as a teacher for the school on the sea through the voyage.

Worked as a reception staff living in the site for 2 and a half years at a hotel for backpackers. Stayed in an Airbnb accommodation in Asakusa for 2 years, working as a staff in the house. For over a decade, the living places were always with other people such as shared houses! 

Because of experiences working as a Montessori teacher, international school teacher, nursery teacher and nannyâ€¦, will always welcome to meet children in MOMO HOUSE.

neighborhood_overview:
"Here Monzennakacho is an irresistibly attractive city for friendly residents of Edokko and those who like downtown.
On the Fukagawa fair, which is held three times a month (1st, 15th, and 28th of every month), about 350 stalls line up on the approach to Tomioka Hachimangu and Fukagawa Fudodo and the shopping street of Eitai-dori, and the cityscape is crowded every time. Tomioka Hachimangu Shrine at night is also recommended. The majestic atmosphere that emerges in the darkness seems to have a greater presence than in the daytime. People are often seen.
If you put your hands together in silence, you will surely be able to reset your day.

In addition, there is Fukagawa Park next to Fukagawa Fudodo, and there are many small parks in the vicinity, so there is no end to the place where children can play. If you go to Kiyosumi Shirakawa, Kiyosumi Park, next to it, Izumi and Tsukiyama There is a beautiful Kiyosumi Garden, which is mainly designated as a scenic spot in To

I manage this guest house with my friend Shigeo and Yoshimi.

My introduction
I like to talk to people from different countries. 

I'm a designer and also an owner of the shared house where people study English.

My purpose for doing B&B is to make people from other countries happy and to have them enjoyed the best staying in Japan.

I'd like people to know not only one side of Japan ( ex. Asakusa, Shibuya, Akihabara ), but also the other side ( local food , culture , people ).

While I'm introducing Japan to foreigners, I'd also like to have Japanese people experienced talking and hanging out with them.
People from my shared house are willing to spend time with travelers.

I like eating, drinking, reading and bourldering.


************************************************
Shigeo Kojima

Hello,
I like to introduce Japanese usual cultures.
I have a lot of wonderful friends any places in a world.
I'm a watchmaker for Swiss watch brand in Tokyo.
I like traveling, taking photos and go out drinking with my friends.

The university has 10Â facultiesÂ and enrolls about 30,000 students, 2,100 of whom are international students. Its five campuses are inÂ HongÅ,Â Komaba,Â Kashiwa,Â ShirokaneÂ andÂ Nakano. It is among the top type of the select Japanese universities assigned additional funding under theÂ MEXT'sÂ Top Global University ProjectÂ to enhance Japan's global educational competitiveness.
The university has graduated many notable alumni, including 17Â Prime Ministers,Â 16 Nobel Prize laureates, 3Â Pritzker PrizeÂ laureates, 3 astronauts, andÂ 1 Fields Medalist.

host_about: Hi folks :) Thanks for your interests. Established in Autumn 2017, FicusTokyo targets to redefine the term â€œstay,â€ and to offer one-of-a-kind travel experience to guests worldwide. Located in between urban area - Akihabara - and historic area - Kanda - FicusTokyo takes responsibility to bridge the past, present and future. FicusTokyo, naming after ficus tree, creates an open space for guests to get together, to communicate, and furthermore, to be engaged in local. FicusTokyo will be more than glad to be your second home in Japan. Years of experience in hotel management, staff here knows better what our guests are expecting, and no doubt, they are ready to serve with their passion, proficient, and proclivity. Why not take FicusTokyo as origin of your journey and explore like local. We offer a variety of room types to meet your needs.

Breakfast is occasionaly served with vegetarian and vegan options available. Homemade bread, miso, and healthy ingredients.

The space

You can stay small room in the shared house.
The building is wooden and gently wrapped with the smell of wood which will heal the tiredness from your journey.
It is shared house.Max 3 person.

Please contact us if you would like to stay for more than 1 month.

room and public space in the shared house.

neighborhood_overview:
You can do various ways to enjoy, such as charm of a quiet residential area in the suburbs, unique restaurant and shops near the station.

There is a large shrine in front of the house and 5 minutes walk to Zenpukuji Park which is blessed with nature like a villa ground. You can experience both urban and natural beauty.

name: Home in Shibuya-ku Â· â˜…4.72 Â· 2 bedrooms Â· 8 beds Â· 1 bath
description:
A 3 stories house in Shinjuku/Shibuya area with 2 bed rooms and a wide living room! 7 min. to Nishi-Shinjuku-5chome sta.

You will love the atmosphere of the house, cosy and welcoming.

Perfect for groups or families, you will benefit from the proximity of Shinjuku/Shibuya and the great access to the rest of the city, while staying.
With Toei Oedo Line(Metro), you will access directly to Ueno, Tsukiji, Yoyogi, and so much places!

Airport/other area pick up is available so please ask if needed!

The space

neighborhood_overview:
7 minutes to Nishi-Shinjuku-gochome station. With Toei Oedo line you will access directly to Ueno, Shibuya, Roppongi, Tsukiji, Yoyogi, Tsukishima, Shinbashi and so much more!

ã€About Shinjukuã€‘

Shinjuku is one of the most popular districts of the whole town and is well known to be one of the center of night life in Tokyo. Also the center of entertainment you will find everything there from shopping, game centers and cat cafes to robot restaurants!

Among the most famous parts of the district you will find the Kabukicho, center of entertainment that gathers plenty of bar (even girls or boys bars ^^), Izakaya type restaurants (bar/restaurant) but also the place where you will find the Godzilla cinema, immense building on the side of which there is a huge Godzilla's statue.

Next to it you will also find the famous 'Golden Gai' which gathers the most traditional bars and izakayas of the city where you non-Japanese weren't allowed until recent years!
host_about:
Hi, everyone!! Thank you very much for visiting my profile.
Iâ€™m Megumi. Iâ€™ve visited many countries for now, Korea, China, Taiwan, Guam, Hawaii, Singapore, USA, Spain, France, Italy,  Australia, New Zealand and Maldives. There Iâ€™ve stayed Airbnb house and talk with many hosts. I felt itâ€™s interesting to entertain guests. So I have hosted countless guests coming from all around the world in Tokyo from Aug2017!! Itâ€™s my pleasure for welcoming people. If I have opportunity to talk with you, I will send you Japanese souvenir. Thank you :)

The Otsuka is popular for the special shopping streets with traditional and modern style.

name: Rental unit in Shinjuku City Â· â˜…New Â· 1 bedroom Â· 1 bed Â· 1 bath
description:
Welcome to Shinjuku !

Just 10 minutes by taxi from Shinjuku Sta.
The nearest station is Takadanobaba Sta. (JR Yamanote Line, Seibu Shinjuku Line, Tokyo Metro Tozai Line), a 6 minute walk from the Waseda Exit.

Access to major spots in Tokyo are within 10-30 minutes by train !
There is a Family Mart within a 2 minute walk, so you can shop nearby during your stay.
There are many restaurants and bar around the nearest station.

We have everything you need.

Business and long-term use are welcome!

The space
PLEASE NOTE THAT THE ROOM IS ON THE 5TH FLOOR AND THERE IS NO ELEVATOR.

We also have other rooms on the 5th floor of the same building, so please take a look at our profile page.

1-2 people : enough space
3 people : You may feel a little cramped

ï½¥ 1 semi-double bed (width x height: 120cm x 200cm)
ï½¥ Single futon set 1 set
It can accommodate up to 3 people.
neighborhood_overview:
Takadanobaba is close to Shinjuku and is a lively town frequented by many young people.
There are also many delicious restaurants and izakayas.

Enjoy your stay in Tokyo based in Takadanobaba.
host_about:
Welcome to my room.

My name is Taku and I'm a grandfather. 
I love traveling and have traveled to more than 20 countries, including Japan.

We rent two rooms in the same building in the Shinjuku area.

Please use our room as a base to enjoy Tokyo and Japan !

Feel free to send us a message if you have any questions.

name: Rental unit in Sumida City Â· â˜…New Â· 1 bedroom Â· 2 beds Â· 1 bath
description:
Welcome!
This modern apartment is located about 3 mins walk from Oshiage station, which you can access to and from Narita and Haneda airports directly.

There's a supermarket and convenience store open 24hrs and the building has security door in the entrance and elevator (this room is on the 4F).

ROOM
1 semi-double bed (2ppl) and 1 single sofa bed (1 pax), total of 3 people can stay.

Guests are free to use kitchen, washing machine and other equipments in the room.

The space
If you're interested in touring around Skytree or Asakusa, this is a great place to stay.

It's not the biggest room in town, but it's a cozy place for solo-traveller, couple or a small family.

Sumidagawa fireworks will be held on July 29th, and it's very close to the venue.

You can also access to other places in Tokyo under 30mins by subway.
If you prefer using trains to and from the 2 airports in Tokyo, you can t
host_about:
Hi, I'm Maichin!
I speak Japanese and English.
Me and my husband love traveling, and spend our weekends taking trips to hot springs.
We realize that going to a foreign country can be a daunting experience, and would love to help. Please feel free to contact us if you have any questions or concerns regarding your stay.

We wish that your trip to Japan will be a special one. Cheers!
